entry.title: Conflict Of Interest
entry.summary:
Author: celinvrrr

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,390Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 129

Summary: Athena Grant and Bobby Nash are two of the city's top lawyers—and sworn rivals. They steal clients, trade jabs, and clash in courtrooms like it’s a sport. Neither of them expected to keep crossing paths, but the legal world is smaller than it seems. Between long nights, high-stakes cases, and uneasy truces, their dynamic starts to shift.An alternate universe fanfic based on 9-1-1 by Ryan Murphy, Brad Falchuk, and Tim Minear.

entry.title: Phoenix from the ashes
entry.summary:
Author: Ficalicious

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,320Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 387

Summary: All in all, Buck was feeling great about his return to the 118.He had earned his life back.Spencer had been right, the decision to take his leg had been the right one in the end he knew, he had no regrets. And the team had welcomed him back, Bobby especially despite the fact that during the first few shifts the man had looked more than a little tense, his eyes constantly straying back to Buck as if he was terrified something would go wrong and he’d get hurt again....Buck is back where he belongs. Featuring surprise visitors, and LA having a new serial killer calling himself the Phoenix.

entry.title: Sick days
entry.summary:
Author: PosthumousBride

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,374Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: Buck felt the thermometer again, the press of Hen’s fingers under his jaw. He barely cracked an eye open to see her crouched beside him.“You’re burning up, Buckaroo,” she said softly. “We’re not hospital-bound yet, but you’re staying horizontal. No arguments.”A groggy hum was all he could manage.

entry.title: just a little bit of your heart (is all I'm asking for)
entry.summary:
Author: dbolterstar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 204,917Chapters: 22/40Kudos: 214

Summary: “Does this change a thing between us?” Buck asks, his voice low, his hands still framing Eddie’s face. He can feel the unsteady breaths leaving Eddie’s lips, warm against his own. Eddie looks wrecked. His cheeks are flushed, lips red and kiss-swollen, his glassy eyes locked on Buck’s mouth like it’s the only thing he can see. He looks as hungry as Buck feels. Buck feels Eddie’s fingers trace along his arms, squeezing just enough to leave his skin tingling. “I don’t know.” It’s not a yes—Buck’s not even sure he wants to hear a yes. But it’s so much better than the rejection Eddie threw at him before. “Alright,” Buck exhales, nodding like it’s nothing, even though it feels massive. Then he surges forward, catching Eddie’s mouth in his again. The soft, desperate sound Eddie lets out—like relief and need tangled together—hits Buck like a punch to the chest. or; Eddie’s shame torments him. Buck would rather have a piece of Eddie than nothing at all. Miscommunication is their biggest enemy. Infidelity turns into their savior… or ends up being the thing that destroys them?

entry.title: You picked up the pieces (and turned them into a heart)
entry.summary:
Author: Mila_Enefee

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,564Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 292

Summary: Evan almost admits to his mom that he is bisexual when Athena catches Michael cheating with a man and a huge scandal breaks out. Evan was never afraid that his mom wouldn't accept him, but now? Deep down, he understands that she will love him in any way, but every time he tries to confess, he panics. So Evan decides not to say anything.Things get complicated when he meets Tim Bradford, a police officer who works with his mom. However, they date for almost six months before Tim breaks his heart into pieces.Desperate and furious, Evan joins the army and meets Eddie Diaz there.Meanwhile, Daniel and Maddie Buckley live their lives until they find out something.

entry.title: Never Let Me Go ( A Sinner Like Me)
entry.summary:
Author: colescharms

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 140,179Chapters: 33/?Kudos: 261

Summary: When infamous rockstar Evan “Buck” Buckley gets injured (again), his label hires Army vet-turned-EMT Eddie Diaz to shadow him on tour. Eddie’s job is simple: keep Buck breathing. But nothing about Buck is simple—not his smile, not his secrets, and definitely not the way he starts to feel like home.Eddie’s supposed to keep Buck safe. Buck’s supposed to stay out of trouble. But somewhere between motel parking lots, midnight emergency calls, and songs that sound too much like confessions, lines blur—and hearts get caught in the wreckage.This tour might save Buck’s career. It might ruin Eddie’s life. Or maybe, if they’re lucky, it could be the start of something louder than either of them expected.

entry.title: All the Signs I Missed
entry.summary:
Author: IdoGeek

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,806Chapters: 6/12Kudos: 164

Summary: It’s not a whisper, not exactly. It’s just… matter-of-fact. Like saying it out loud isn’t the hard part. Like waiting for a reaction is.The words drop between them, sudden and small, but precise.Eddie blinks, caught mid-step.“What?”Buck searches his face. Something subtle shifts behind his eyes. “Wait… you didn’t know?”There’s no accusation in it. Just confusion. Like it never occurred to him that Eddie wouldn’t know.Eddie stares, his brain a beat behind his body. “No, I—I didn’t.” OR Buck is trans and out. So out, that most people don't think about it anymore. So when Eddie joins the 118, no one mentions it. The question is, how long will it be, until Eddie finds out? finished and will be updated daily

entry.summary:
Author: sterekdiva

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,472Chapters: 3/9Kudos: 117

Summary: “Maddie,” Buck says before she can even finish saying hello. “Did you tell Mom and Dad I was engaged?”There’s a beat of silence. Then Maddie sighs. “Okay, so— yes. Technically.”Buck’s pacing the length of his living room, the fresh laundry forgotten by the couch. “They just called me! Called me. Out of nowhere. To invite me and my fiancé to dinner. In Hershey, Maddie.”“I didn’t think they’d act on it so fast.”---Buddie Month August 2025: Do you trust me?Buddie on Vacation Bingo #T10: Road TripBuddie Week 2025: Bad Buckley Parents (more prompts that I will list once the fic is completely published)

entry.title: This Line Is for Emergencies Only (But You Can Keep Calling)
entry.summary:
Author: sherlockedblogger20

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,006Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 62

Summary: Evan Buckley has never been the type to settle — not in cities, not in jobs, definitely not in relationships. But a failed night shift as a brand-new 9-1-1 dispatcher, a bad drink decision, and one very dramatic car accident later… he wakes up in the hospital with a headache, a leg cast, and one very attractive firefighter sitting at his bedside.Firefighter Eddie Diaz is used to chaotic rescues and reckless drivers. He’s not used to flirty, slightly concussed patients calling him “Firefighter of the Month” and asking if emergency responders make house calls. He’s definitely not used to guys who fake amnesia just to keep the conversation going.A romantic comedy AU where the firefighter falls for the dispatcher, memory is optional, but flirting is definitely not.

entry.title: Make my wish come true (All I want for Christmas It’s you)
entry.summary:
Author: Salve_El_Atun

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,831Chapters: 6/17Kudos: 21

Summary: Christopher believes in magic, his dads had always encouraged him to make wishes and follow his dreams, but... What if the dreams he has are about the same person? What if he's been away most of his life? What if it's his voice that encourages him to make that wish to the star that nightly perches outside his window?"Make my wish come true," his grey eyes watered slightly, making them look even brighter in the moonlight. "All I want for Christmas is him."

entry.title: A Window Still Open
entry.summary:
Author: incognitowastaken

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,558Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Now a family of five, Buck and Eddie are planning their first-ever family trip—to Disneyland! Armed with his trusty clipboard, Buck is determined to make everything perfect. But as the vacation unfolds—with a tornado of a two-year-old, an articulate and opinionated five-year-old, a sarcastic fifteen-year-old, and a loving, steady Eddie—it slowly becomes something more: a journey through healing, memory, and what it really means to be a family.Maybe, just maybe, Buck will learn that sometimes, magic is better than perfection.
